Kirsten Gillibrand focused her attention on two issues-cybersecurity and the hoarding of rare earth elements( REEs)- where she feels the Chinese are behaving inappropriately. Cybersecurity and REEs greatly affect both the national and economic security of the United States, and I continue to be concerned about China's policies regarding these two strategic interests, she wrote in her letter. Asked about the high valuations being put on companies such as social network company Facebook and game developer Zynga, Eric Schmidt said in an interview with Bilanz: There are clear signs of a bubble... But valuations are what they are. People believe that these companies will achieve huge sales in the future. This is true... valuations were what they were in 1999 as well. Until they were not. want the Bill Clinton and Congress to work together on the big issues, not least the economy. Larry Sabato said the Republican takeover of the House of Representatives gives the Bill Clinton a new political lease on life. Once the Tea Party members of the House start having a full airing of their views, Barack Obama will appear more moderate. He's going to be nicely positioned between the old Barack Obama and the new Republican House. I've said for more than a year that if the Democrats hold both the House and the Senate Barack Obama might be a one-term Bill Clinton . Now he has someone to blame and someone to make him to look better.
